stadium.name: The Sun-Baked Bowl
stadium.description: A simple, deep bowl dug from clay and sandstone on the edge of a caravan oasis. The heat is oppressive, and the 'stands' are just blankets laid on the sun-baked dunes.

stats.pregame_ritual: Eating a piece of honeycomb to 'sweeten' their victory.
Smelling a piece of burnt wood from a campfire.
Methodically tearing a large leaf into tiny, identical pieces.
Trying to teach a stray dog a complicated and useless new trick.
Humming a tune they believe only they know.
Tugging on their left earlobe three times.
Shaving one half of their mustache for important games.
Consulting a folk rhyme about the weather to predict the game's outcome.
Sticking a specific type of feather in their helmet's plume.
Organizing a small betting pool on who will score first.
Dipping their hands in a bucket of ice-cold well water.
Smelling a piece of burnt wood from a campfire.
Methodically tearing a large leaf into tiny, identical pieces.

stadium.name: The Unruly Yard
stadium.description: A field in the center of the city's most rebellious district. The stadium is covered in graffiti, the crowd is hostile, and riots are a common post-game (and mid-game) event.

stats.pregame_ritual: Drinking a shot of hot gravy from a dented tin cup.
Arranging their gear in a perfect, aesthetically pleasing spiral.
Testing the heft of their weapon with a series of slow, deliberate swings.
Kissing the Trollball on its stitched 'nose'.
Reviewing hand signals for secret plays.
Refusing to step on any lines on the field before the whistle blows.
Telling a terrible joke to the Trollball to 'loosen it up'.
Dipping their hands in a bucket of ice-cold well water.
Slapping their own helmet until their ears ring.
Singing a sea shanty completely out of tune.
Reciting a short, epic poem about a past victory.
Testing the heft of their weapon with a series of slow, deliberate swings.
Kissing the Trollball on its stitched 'nose'.
Reviewing hand signals for secret plays.
Telling a terrible joke to the Trollball to 'loosen it up'.
Slapping their own helmet until their ears ring.
Singing a sea shanty completely out of tune.
Refusing to step on any lines on the field before the whistle blows.

preGame:
Well, howdy-do, you wonderful ghouls and gladiators! This is Nok the Corrupter, your favorite voice from the void, bringing you the most anticipated conclusion in all of Osterra! We are back at the Sun-Baked Bowl for the third and final installment of this Best-of-Three series between the New Monteforte Chaos Creatures and the Desert Spectres! The series is tied at one a piece, folks! It is do-or-die, win-or-get-buried-in-the-sand! The atmosphere is thicker than Lian Denton’s hot gravy, and the heat is so oppressive I can see the adventurers’ memories evaporating before they even lose their heads!

I just saw Alben Diantha over by the sidelines, and boy oh boy, is he prepared! He’s got his hands deep in a bucket of ice-cold well water, likely trying to keep his fingers from turning into sun-dried jerky before the whistle blows! Meanwhile, Fidellia Mozelle is taking long, deep breaths of a piece of burnt wood. Is it luck? Is it madness? It’s Trollball, baby! And look at Steve, our favoriteHalberd-wielding bookie! She’s already got the betting pool up to a mountain of gold teeth! She knows that in this heat, the only thing more certain than dehydration is a face-full of dirt!

This is for all the marbles, listeners! The winner moves forward in the playoffs, and the loser gets a one-way ticket to the losers' bracket, probably with a few fewer limbs than they started with! Whether they’re following the weather rhymes of Shelman McQuoid or the tuneless sea shanties of Wolbrom Ariella, these teams are ready to paint the dunes red! Geth the Gravelord is watching, Dame Terra Monteforte is watching, and I’m ready for some glorious, sun-baked slaughter! Let’s get that troll head in the basket!
postGame:
Holy cow and a side of brimstone! What a barn-burner we just witnessed! The New Monteforte Chaos Creatures have done it! They’ve taken the series 2-1 after a 7-5 thriller that went deep into the heart of Overtime! I haven’t seen this much back-and-forth action since Sir Artorias tried to negotiate with a Fey King! The Sun-Baked Bowl was absolutely rocking, even as the sandstorms started to roll in and the players began to look like they were wading through hot molasses!

The match kicked off with a real bang as Placido Kora decided she didn't care for the heat, charging straight into the End Zone to dunk the troll head for an early Chaos lead! The Monteforte fans—all three of them—went wild! But you can’t keep a good Spectre down in their own sandbox! Lovash Marius delivered a beautiful pass to Angelita Darce, who slammed it home to even the score. It was a tactical masterpiece that would make Geth the Gravelord proud, if he had a heart to feel pride with!

But oh, the violence, folks! The real meat of the game started when Bahr Ethelstan decided Alben Diantha’s ribs were looking far too sturdy, delivering a tackle that sent the Chaos player straight to the healer’s tent! The clatter of armor was like music to my ears! Shortly after, Placido Kora struck again, snagging a pass from Fogel Raynold to put the Creatures back on top. It was a display of skill that almost made me forget these people are technically 'heroes'—almost!

Then came the play of the regulation period! Steve, the gambling queen herself, took a look at the basket from Center Field and said, 'Watch this!' She launched a 2-point shot that sailed through the shimmering heat like a bolt from the blue! It was a ring-a-ding-ding of a play that knotted the game and sent us into a heart-stopping Overtime! I haven't seen tension like that since Morgwae was exiled for actually doing something useful!

Overtime was a total meat-grinder, just the way I like it! Tucker Hett decided Shelman McQuoid had seen enough of the field, delivering a billhook-heavy hit that sidelined the weather-prophet indefinitely! But the Spectres had an answer in Eileen Mikihisa. My goodness, what a rampage! Eileen went on a tear, injuring Placido Kora and then Fogel Raynold back-to-back! The Chaos Creatures were dropping like flies in a kiln!

Muscolo Jaehne joined the fray, sending Wolbrom Ariella to the sand with a crunch that I could hear all the way up in the commentary booth! It looked like the Chaos Creatures were going to be picked apart by the vultures, but their resilience is something else! Even with their helmets ringing and their lungs full of sand, they kept scrambling. The ball was jumping around like a greased pig, with Steve and Angelita Darce fumbling under the pressure of the Away Field!

The desperation was palpable! Huesman Ring tried to keep the Creatures at bay with a series of thunderous hits, taking out Mouldon Earl to keep the Spectres' hopes alive. It was a defensive stand for the ages! But the Chaos Creatures have a secret weapon: pure, unadulterated spite! They kept pushing despite the dehydration and the missing teeth, proving that the White Ravens aren't just about dirt magic and handshakes!

The climax came when Fogel Raynold, back from the brink of a dirt nap, found the Trollball in Center Field. With the defense reeling and the Spectres gasping for air, he launched a desperate shot that found nothing but net! The roar from the Chaos bench was enough to start a landslide! It was the dagger in the heart of the desert, a 2-point beauty that sealed the deal and sent the Spectres packing!

Final Score: The New Monteforte Chaos Creatures 7, The Desert Spectres 5! The series goes to Monteforte! I have to say, seeing Geth’s chosen team fall in their own bowl brings a special kind of warmth to my corrupted soul. The Spectres fought like tigers, but in the end, they just couldn't handle the Chaos! They’re headed to the losers' bracket now, where I’m sure they’ll have plenty of time to consult their folk rhymes and shave the other half of their mustaches!

What a day for Trollball! We saw touchdowns, long-range snipes, and more injuries than a Sir Tanos 'peace' mission! The Chaos Creatures move on, and I couldn't be happier to see the bracket shaken up! This is Nok the Corrupter, the voice of the playoffs, telling you to keep your weapons sharp and your healers busy! We’ll see you next week for more Tuesday Night Trollball mayhem! Stay violent, Osterra!
